name: Kedarnath Temple (Jyotirlinga)
description: One of 12 Jyotirlingas, highest Shiva temple at 3,583m, Chota Char Dham pilgrimage site, trekking route from Gaurikund, Himalayan backdrop, 2013 flood survivor.

name: Badrinath Temple
description: Char Dham pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Vishnu, 3,133m altitude, Tapt Kund hot springs, Neelkanth Peak backdrop, Mana village (last Indian village near Tibet border).

name: Gangotri Temple
description: Chota Char Dham site, origin of Ganges River from Gaumukh glacier, 3,100m altitude, 18th-century Ganga temple, Bhagirathi River, trekking to Gaumukh.

name: Yamunotri Temple
description: Chota Char Dham site, source of Yamuna River at 3,293m, Surya Kund hot spring for cooking rice offerings, trekking route from Janki Chatti, Divya Shila rock worship.

name: Haridwar Ganga Ghats
description: Where Ganges enters plains from Himalayas, Har Ki Pauri ghat with evening Ganga aarti, Kumbh Mela venue, Mansa Devi and Chandi Devi temples via cable car.

name: Rishikesh (Yoga Capital)
description: Yoga capital of the world, ashrams, Beatles Ashram, Ganga aarti at Triveni Ghat, white water rafting, Laxman Jhula, Ram Jhula suspension bridges, adventure hub.

name: Laxman Jhula
description: Iconic 450-foot suspension bridge over Ganges, mythological connection to Laxman, pedestrian bridge linking Tapovan to Jonk, surrounded by temples and ashrams.

name: Nainital Lake
description: Kidney-shaped lake at 2,084m, boating, Mall Road, Naina Devi Temple, Snow View Point via ropeway, Tiffin Top, colonial hill station charm, Kumaon hills.

name: Mussoorie
description: Queen of Hills at 2,005m, Mall Road, Kempty Falls, Gun Hill viewpoint via cable car, Lal Tibba highest point, colonial architecture, Himalayan views.

name: Auli
description: Premier ski destination at 2,500-3,050m, skiing slopes, cable car (Asia's longest), Nanda Devi and Mana Parbat views, artificial lake, adventure sports, winter paradise.

name: Valley of Flowers National Park
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, alpine flower meadows at 3,658m, 500+ species of flowers including rare Brahma Kamal, snow leopards, Asiatic black bears, trekking paradise.

name: Hemkund Sahib
description: Sacred Sikh shrine at 4,632m beside glacial lake, seven-peaked mountain setting, Guru Gobind Singh meditation site, Lakshman Temple nearby, challenging trek from Govindghat.

name: Jim Corbett National Park
description: India's oldest national park and Project Tiger reserve (1936), Bengal tigers, elephants, 580+ bird species, Dhikala zone, Ramganga River, diverse ecosystems, safari zones.

name: Rajaji National Park
description: 820 sq km park at Himalayan foothills, elephants, tigers, leopards, 400+ bird species, Chilla, Motichur, and Rajaji zones, Ganges and Song rivers, sal forests.

name: Chopta (Mini Switzerland)
description: Untouched meadows at 2,680m, base for Tungnath-Chandrashila trek, camping, birdwatching, rhododendron forests, Himalayan panoramas, serene offbeat destination.

name: Tungnath Temple
description: World's highest Shiva temple at 3,680m, Panch Kedar pilgrimage site, 3.5 km trek from Chopta, 1,000-year-old temple, Nanda Devi and Chaukhamba peaks views.

name: Chandrashila Trek
description: Summit at 4,000m beyond Tungnath, 360-degree Himalayan views of Nanda Devi, Trishul, Chaukhamba peaks, moderate trek, mythological significance where Rama meditated.

name: Pithoragarh
description: Little Kashmir, Soar Valley at 1,645m, Pithoragarh Fort, gateway to Kailash Mansarovar, Panchachuli peaks views, Askot Wildlife Sanctuary, remote Himalayan charm.

name: Binsar Wildlife Sanctuary
description: 47 sq km sanctuary at 2,420m, 200+ bird species, leopards, Himalayan bears, oak and rhododendron forests, Zero Point with 300 km Himalayan panorama, eco-tourism.

name: Almora
description: Cultural capital of Kumaon at 1,638m, Chand dynasty heritage, Nanda Devi Temple, Kasar Devi, Bright End Corner sunset point, traditional bazaars, copper handicrafts.

name: Jageshwar Dham
description: 124 ancient Shiva temples in deodar forest from 9th-13th centuries, one of 12 Jyotirlinga candidates, Nagesh Jyotirlinga, archaeological site, tranquil spiritual atmosphere.

name: Tehri Lake
description: Asia's highest dam reservoir at 830m, water sports including jet skiing, banana boat, kayaking, camping, Himalayan backdrop, created by Tehri Dam on Bhagirathi River.

name: Kausani
description: Switzerland of India at 1,890m, 300 km panoramic view of Nanda Devi, Trishul, Panchachuli peaks, Anasakti Ashram (Mahatma Gandhi stayed), tea gardens, sunrise views.

name: Char Dham Yatra (Route)
description: Sacred Chota Char Dham circuit covering Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, Badrinath, Hindu pilgrimage journey through Himalayas, spiritual significance, challenging mountain routes.
